verses.name: Acts 28:7
verses.text: In the same quarters were possessions of the chief man of the island, whose name was Publius; who received us, and lodged us three days courteously.

verses.name: Acts 28:8
verses.text: And it came to pass, that the father of Publius lay sick of a fever and of a bloody flux: to whom Paul entered in, and prayed, and laid his hands on him, and healed him.

verses.name: Acts 28:9
verses.text: So when this was done, others also, which had diseases in the island, came, and were healed:

verses.name: Acts 28:10
verses.text: Who also honoured us with many honours; and when we departed, they laded us with such things as were necessary.
